docs.snippet: The Bagger can't find the interview online, but Rolling Stone's chat with Sean Penn included a cool vignette from Mr. Penn....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bagger can't find the interview online, but Rolling Stone's chat with Sean Penn included a cool vignette from Mr. Penn. He and Paul Thomas Anderson had both finished their films - "Into the Wild" and "There Will Be Blood," respectively - and were showing the finished work to each other. Mr. Penn made it clear in the interview that part of what drove him to go deep in bringing Harvey Milk alive was watching Daniel Day-Lewis's no-holds-barred, Oscar-winning performance as Daniel Plainview.
docs.abstract: The Bagger can't find the interview online, but Rolling Stone's chat with Sean Penn included a cool vignette from Mr. Penn.

docs.snippet: Executives there believe that Danny Boyle is a lock for best director, but that the movie itself might face some very real competition from "The Curious Case of Benjamin Button," a huge movie with the backing of two studios, nearly a $150 million ...
docs.lead_paragraph: You'd think the folks at Fox Searchlight would be at their ease right now, seeming to be riding into Oscar week with a big lead for "Slumdog Millionaire," but someone the Bagger talked to there says the studio is not counting its chickens just yet.
docs.abstract: Executives there believe that Danny Boyle is a lock for best director, but that the movie itself might face some very real competition from "The Curious Case of Benjamin Button," a huge movie with the backing of two studios, nearly a $150 million budget and big stars.
